definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Does false myopia wear presbyopic glasses to restore to get vision not?
sentences.chinese: 假近視戴老花鏡恢復得視力不？

sentences.english: But the Australian study says they may create problems impairing balance.
sentences.chinese: 但是澳大利亞的研究顯示帶老花鏡可能會損害平衡感。

sentences.english: The old man often wears a pair of presbyopic glasses when he reads newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 那個老人看報紙的時候常常戴着一副老花鏡。

sentences.english: This can be disposed through old reading glasses.
sentences.chinese: 此時可經由老花鏡處置。

sentences.english: Types of presbyopic glasses used by scholars are exhibited in the museum.
sentences.chinese: 陳列着以前文人們用過的各式各樣的老花鏡。

definition: weight/pendant/same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]/ballad singing accompanied by a 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
with dishevelled hair (idiom)/with one's hair down
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
that/that kind of/that sort of/that type of
felt-tip pen/roller ball pen/gel ink pen
